flawed_nl_solution:
The first night he read 20% of his 500-page book so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is 500 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 500-100 = <<500-100=400>>400 pages
The second night he reads 20% of the 500 pages so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=10>>10 pages
The book is now 400 pages and he read 10 so that leaves 400-10 = <<400-10=390>>390 pages
The third night he read 30% of the book so he read 0.3*500 = <<30*0.01*500=150>>150 pages
The book is now 390 pages and he read 150 pages so he has 390-150 =<<390-150=240>>240 pages left to read
#### 240

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100, not 10. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
